results.title: A Portrait of the artist as a young man
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick and Ulysses Film Production
results.brief_description: This magnificent adaption of James Joyce’s autobiographical novel is a faithful portrait of the young author and his coming-of-age. It portrays Stephen Dedalus and his Irish Catholic upbringing, his confrontation with the tyranny of the Church and his sexual guilt and frustration which start him on the path of rebellion. The young artist chooses lonely exile in his search for freedom and truth. Starring Bosco Hogan, T.P. McKenna and John Gielgud.

results.title: A Portrait of Katherine Mansfield
results.creator_credit: Julienne Stretton, Sue Kedgely and Marigold Productions
results.brief_description: This is the story of the short and extraordinary life of New Zealand writer Katherine Mansfield. Katherine Mansfield was one of the great short stories writers of the English language. Her work is still studied in over twenty languages.

results.title: A Portrait of Bishhop Carlos Ximenes Belo
results.creator_credit: Max Stahl, Intervision and Gillan Films
results.brief_description: This program documents the impact of the Indonesian invasion of East Timor. It particularly focuses on the role of Bishop Carlos Ximenes Belo. He believes that he should be outspoken about the atrocities suffered by the people of East Timor because of the Indonesian occupation. The format consists of film footage depicting life in East Timor: a commentary and interviews with Bishop Belo, the Indonesian General Herman Mantiri and East Timorese people.

results.title: A Pornographic affair = Une Liaison pornographique [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Frederic Fonteyne, Claude Waringo, Rolf Schmid, Patrick Quinet, Canal+, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF), Fama Film, ARP, Le Production Lazemec, Samsa Film and Artemis Productions
results.brief_description: Two strangers, played by Nathalie Baye and Sergi Lopez, meet through a personal ad in a pornographic magazine. They are both interested in exploring a sexual fantasy that for a variety of reasons they feel shy of disclosing with regular partners. Filmed in flashback, while the two characters are interviewed straight to the camera, this erotic and intelligent film explores how men and women are navigating the fraught arena of sexual desire in a post-feminist and post-macho culture. Both Baye and Lopez deliver charming and realistic performances in which they present the ambiguities and contradictions of modern urban life: on one hand proud and happy with their independence; on the other aching for the comfort and solidity of dependency. In the end, the sexual fantasy which begins this pornographic affair, does not matter: it is up to the viewer to interpret the relationship through the nature of our own desires and fantasies. Beyond sex, desire and fantasy, “A Pornographic Affair” argues that what matters is our ability to communicate and to be open to being touched by another human being. In French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frederic Fonteyne, Claude Waringo, Rolf Schmid, Patrick Quinet, Canal+, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF), Fama Film, ARP, Le Production Lazemec, Samsa Film and Artemis Productions

results.title: A Poor man shames us all
results.creator_credit: Richard Meech, Michael Grant and Biniman Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Millennium: tribal wisdom and the modern world”.
Explore the alternative views of wealth and society that are exhibited in the lives of tribal cultures. This episode takes viewers from New York to the jungles of Indonesia and the plains of Kenya. Learn why our western views of wealth and economic needs have created a society of strangers in the midst of material riches, while tribal cultures such as the Wayewa of Indonesia and the Gabra of Kenya create economies of dependency on others and measure wealth through people, not possessions. Follow host/narrator David Maybury-Lewis as he traces the development of free market economies and explores how its characteristics contrast with tribal conceptions of wealth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Meech, Michael Grant and Biniman Productions

results.title: A Point of return
results.creator_credit: Carl Stevenson and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents the problem of suicide as discussed by doctors, psychiatrists, and social workers. Uses a case history to point out that the causes and related aspects of suicide are not always understood. Includes an introduction by Dr Karl Menninger.

results.title: A Poem by Edward Lear: The Owl and the pussy-cat
results.creator_credit: John Korty, McGraw-Hill Films and Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: Uses animation to portray the children’s poem ‘The Owl and the Pussy-cat’, by Edward Lear, in which the owl and the pussycat jump into their pea-green boat and sail out to the sea. Narrated by Cyril Ritchard. Suitable for lower primary level.
